DataElement.preferredName: Patient Sputum Sample Not Submitted Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field used to describe the reason the sputum sample for a participant was not submitted.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to a sputum sample for a patient/participant on a study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredDefinition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.
A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredName: Sputum Sample Not Submitted Reason Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text used to describe the reason why the material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus was not submitted.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Sputum Specimen Negation Submission Reason Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Material containing mucus, cellular debris, microorganisms and sometimes blood or pus.  It is ejected through the mouth from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
